trans-unit.source: What is HBase in HDInsight: A NoSQL database that provides BigTable-like capabilities for Hadoop
trans-unit.target: What is HBase in HDInsight: A NoSQL database that provides BigTable-like capabilities for Hadoop

trans-unit.source: Apache HBase is an open-source, NoSQL database that is built on Hadoop and modeled after Google BigTable.
trans-unit.target: Apache HBase is an open-source, NoSQL database that is built on Hadoop and modeled after Google BigTable.

trans-unit.source: HBase provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data in a schemaless database organized by column families.
trans-unit.target: HBase provides random access and strong consistency for large amounts of unstructured and semistructured data in a schemaless database organized by column families.

trans-unit.source: Data is stored in the rows of a table, and data within a row is grouped by column family.
trans-unit.target: Data is stored in the rows of a table, and data within a row is grouped by column family.

trans-unit.source: HBase is a schemaless database in the sense that neither the columns nor the type of data stored in them need to be defined before using them.
trans-unit.target: HBase is a schemaless database in the sense that neither the columns nor the type of data stored in them need to be defined before using them.

trans-unit.source: The open-source code scales linearly to handle petabytes of data on thousands of nodes.
trans-unit.target: The open-source code scales linearly to handle petabytes of data on thousands of nodes.

trans-unit.source: It can rely on data redundancy, batch processing, and other features that are provided by distributed applications in the Hadoop ecosystem.
trans-unit.target: It can rely on data redundancy, batch processing, and other features that are provided by distributed applications in the Hadoop ecosystem.

trans-unit.source: How is HBase implemented in Azure HDInsight?
trans-unit.target: How is HBase implemented in Azure HDInsight?

trans-unit.source: HDInsight HBase is offered as a managed cluster that is integrated into the Azure environment.
trans-unit.target: HDInsight HBase is offered as a managed cluster that is integrated into the Azure environment.

trans-unit.source: The clusters are configured to store data directly in Azure Blob storage, which provides low latency and increased elasticity in performance and cost choices.
trans-unit.target: The clusters are configured to store data directly in Azure Blob storage, which provides low latency and increased elasticity in performance and cost choices.

trans-unit.source: This enables customers to build interactive websites that work with large datasets, to build services that store sensor and telemetry data from millions of end points, and to analyze this data with Hadoop jobs.
trans-unit.target: This enables customers to build interactive websites that work with large datasets, to build services that store sensor and telemetry data from millions of end points, and to analyze this data with Hadoop jobs.

trans-unit.source: HBase and Hadoop are good starting points for big data project in Azure; in particular, they can enable real-time applications to work with large datasets.
trans-unit.target: HBase and Hadoop are good starting points for big data project in Azure; in particular, they can enable real-time applications to work with large datasets.

trans-unit.source: The HDInsight implementation leverages the scale-out architecture of HBase to provide automatic sharding of tables, strong consistency for reads and writes, and automatic failover.
trans-unit.target: The HDInsight implementation leverages the scale-out architecture of HBase to provide automatic sharding of tables, strong consistency for reads and writes, and automatic failover.

trans-unit.source: Performance is enhanced by in-memory caching for reads and high-throughput streaming for writes.
trans-unit.target: Performance is enhanced by in-memory caching for reads and high-throughput streaming for writes.

trans-unit.source: Virtual network provisioning is also available for HDInsight HBase.
trans-unit.target: Virtual network provisioning is also available for HDInsight HBase.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Provision HDInsight clusters on Azure Virtual Network] [hbase-provision-vnet].
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Provision HDInsight clusters on Azure Virtual Network] [hbase-provision-vnet].

trans-unit.source: How is data managed in HDInsight HBase?
trans-unit.target: How is data managed in HDInsight HBase?

trans-unit.source: Data can be managed in HBase by using the `create`, `get`, `put`, and `scan` commands from the HBase shell.
trans-unit.target: Data can be managed in HBase by using the `create`, `get`, `put`, and `scan` commands from the HBase shell.

trans-unit.source: Data is written to the database by using `put` and read by using `get`.
trans-unit.target: Data is written to the database by using `put` and read by using `get`.

trans-unit.source: The `scan` command is used to obtain data from multiple rows in a table.
trans-unit.target: The `scan` command is used to obtain data from multiple rows in a table.

trans-unit.source: Data can also be managed using the HBase C# API, which provides a client library on top of the HBase REST API.
trans-unit.target: Data can also be managed using the HBase C# API, which provides a client library on top of the HBase REST API.

trans-unit.source: An HBase database can also be queried by using Hive.
trans-unit.target: An HBase database can also be queried by using Hive.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction to these programming models, see [Get started using HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight][hbase-get-started].
trans-unit.target: For an introduction to these programming models, see [Get started using HBase with Hadoop in HDInsight][hbase-get-started].

trans-unit.source: Co-processors are also available, which allow data processing in the nodes that host the database.
trans-unit.target: Co-processors are also available, which allow data processing in the nodes that host the database.

trans-unit.source: Scenarios: Use cases for HBase
trans-unit.target: Scenarios: Use cases for HBase

trans-unit.source: The canonical use case for which BigTable (and by extension, HBase) was created was web search.
trans-unit.target: The canonical use case for which BigTable (and by extension, HBase) was created was web search.

trans-unit.source: Search engines build indexes that map terms to the web pages that contain them.
trans-unit.target: Search engines build indexes that map terms to the web pages that contain them.

trans-unit.source: But there are many other use cases that HBase is suitable for—several of which are itemized in this section.
trans-unit.target: But there are many other use cases that HBase is suitable for—several of which are itemized in this section.

trans-unit.source: Key-value store
trans-unit.target: Key-value store

trans-unit.source: HBase can be used as a key-value store, and it is suitable for managing message systems.
trans-unit.target: HBase can be used as a key-value store, and it is suitable for managing message systems.

trans-unit.source: Facebook uses HBase for their messaging system, and it is ideal for storing and managing Internet communications.
trans-unit.target: Facebook uses HBase for their messaging system, and it is ideal for storing and managing Internet communications.

trans-unit.source: WebTable uses HBase to search for and manage tables that are extracted from webpages.
trans-unit.target: WebTable uses HBase to search for and manage tables that are extracted from webpages.

trans-unit.source: Sensor data
trans-unit.target: Sensor data

trans-unit.source: HBase is useful for capturing data that is collected incrementally from various sources.
trans-unit.target: HBase is useful for capturing data that is collected incrementally from various sources.

trans-unit.source: This includes social analytics, time series, keeping interactive dashboards up-to-date with trends and counters, and managing audit log systems.
trans-unit.target: This includes social analytics, time series, keeping interactive dashboards up-to-date with trends and counters, and managing audit log systems.

trans-unit.source: Examples include Bloomberg trader terminal and the Open Time Series Database (OpenTSDB), which stores and provides access to metrics collected about the health of server systems.
trans-unit.target: Examples include Bloomberg trader terminal and the Open Time Series Database (OpenTSDB), which stores and provides access to metrics collected about the health of server systems.

trans-unit.source: Real-time query
trans-unit.target: Real-time query

trans-unit.source: [Phoenix](http://phoenix.apache.org/) is a SQL query engine for Apache HBase.
trans-unit.target: [Phoenix](http://phoenix.apache.org/) is a SQL query engine for Apache HBase.

trans-unit.source: It is accessed as a JDBC driver, and it enables querying and managing HBase tables by using SQL.
trans-unit.target: It is accessed as a JDBC driver, and it enables querying and managing HBase tables by using SQL.

trans-unit.source: HBase as a platform
trans-unit.target: HBase as a platform

trans-unit.source: Applications can run on top of HBase by using it as a datastore.
trans-unit.target: Applications can run on top of HBase by using it as a datastore.

trans-unit.source: Examples include Phoenix, OpenTSDB, Kiji, and Titan.
trans-unit.target: Examples include Phoenix, OpenTSDB, Kiji, and Titan.

trans-unit.source: Applications can also integrate with HBase.
trans-unit.target: Applications can also integrate with HBase.

trans-unit.source: Examples include Hive, Pig, Solr, Storm, Flume, Impala, Spark, Ganglia, and Drill.
trans-unit.target: Examples include Hive, Pig, Solr, Storm, Flume, Impala, Spark, Ganglia, and Drill.
